results.title: Bachelor Girl
results.creator_credit: Ned Lander, Yarra Bank Films, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission and Rivka Hartman
results.brief_description: Dot (Lyn Pierse) is a modern, confident, single woman who writes for a local soap. Content with single life, Dot finds a number of ways to fend off her mother who desperately tries to ‘hook her up’ with various migrating male folk, but Dot is summoned by the boss at the eleventh hour to save a failing plotline… As she and the crew hash-out potential scenarios her personal life escalates in Romance. But will love continue to bloom or will the fanciful story take-over? Contains footage of Melbourne (St.Kilda, Royal Botanic Gardens, Brighton Beach and Victoria Market). Cast includes: Kim Gyngell, Bruce Spence, Jan Friedl, Doug Tremlett, Ruth Yaffe, Jane Turner, Tim Robertson, Mark Minchinton, Mark Little, John Flaus and Lynda Gibson.

results.title: BabaKiueria
results.creator_credit: Julian Pringle, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Geoffrey Atherden and Don Featherstone
results.brief_description:
‘BabaKiueria’ takes a satirical look at black-white relations in late twentieth century Australia, with a comic depiction of a racial role reversal. In documentary (or ‘mockumentary’) style, the film’s presenter investigates white lives in the fictitious land of ‘BabaKiueria’ (‘Barbeque Area’), where white people are a minority, living under black laws and suffering from discriminatory practices and attitudes held by the black majority. Written by Geoffrey Atherden (‘Mother and Son’, ‘Grass Roots’), the film was awarded a United Nations Media Peace Prize in 1987.
Stars Michelle Torres, Bob Maza, Kevin Smith, Cecily Polson, Tony Barry.

results.title: Ay Carmela
results.creator_credit: Carlos Saura, Andres Gomes, Television Espanola, Ellepi Films and Iberoamerican Films
results.brief_description: Ay Carmela is set during the Spanish Civil War in 1938 when control of the cities and towns was continually in a state of flux as the communist Republican armies battled with the Franco led fascist forces in attacks and counter-attacks. Carmela (Carmen Maura - “Women on the verge of a nervous breakdown” 1987) and Paulino (Andres Pajares) along with the mute Gustavete (Gabino Diego) have been travelling on the road entertaining frontline Republican troops under the banner of the Tip-Top Variety Show. Carmela sings and dances, Paulino recites poetry and Gustavete plays guitar and together they perform and act out short comedic scenes and entertain in the true vaudevillian tradition. However when they are captured by Mussolini’s soldiers on their way to Valencia, choices have to be made. Morality, loyalty, survival are put to the test for Carmela and Paulino, both on a personal and artist’s level. Will they resist, or co-operate with the demands put on them to perform for the Fascist officers and a group of captured Polish prisoners who are doomed to be executed the morning after the show? And what about the Italian Lieutenant who is in charge of producing/directing the show - can Carmela and Paulino agree to the changes in the words of their songs and poetry to reflect the fascist ideology? Will they compromise themselves to save their own lives? “Ay Carmela” is a strange blend of farcical comedy, music, dance, and politics and may prove a disappointment to Carlos Saura fans (director of Carmen and Blood Wedding). However, Carmen Maura puts in an excellent performance as does Andres Pajares and the theme of artists and morality is an interesting one. Cast also includes Maurizio de Razza, Jose Sancho, Mario de Candia, Miguel Angel Rellan, Edward Zentara. A Spanish-Italian co-production.

results.title: Automania 2000
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and John Halas
results.brief_description: An animated satire on problems of automotive design and lack of proper roads and parking facilities. Shows what could happen in the year 2000 when people are forced to live in their cars and the car finally becomes able to reproduce itself. Animator: Harold Whitaker; Writer: Joy Batchelor.

results.title: Austin Powers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Suzanne Todd, Demi Moore, Jennifer Todd, Mike Myers and Jay Roach
results.brief_description: Comedian Mike Myers (Wayne’s World) takes on the dual role of sixties super spy, renowned fashion photographer and insatiable casanova Austin Powers and his arch-enemy Dr Evil in this colourful parody of the James Bond films. Starting off in swinging London of the sixties, the film quickly moves into the present when Austin Powers must travel across time to stop Dr. Evil’s world conquering exploits, who has cryogenically frozen himself (and his cat Mr. Bigglesworth) and resurfaced in the nineties. Much of the films fish out of water humour is based on the difficulty Austin has in adjusting to a modern world that has little tolerance for a promiscuous, sexist, British secret agent with bad teeth and Dr Evil’s thwarted plans to outsmart a society that is far more advanced in notions of evil. Cast also includes Mimi Rogers, Elizabeth Hurley, Michael York and Robert Wagner.

results.title: Au revoir les enfants
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle and Nouvelles Éditions de Films
results.brief_description: In the words of the director himself, “Au revoir les enfants is drawn from the most dramatic experience of my childhood. In 1944, when I was eleven, I was boarding in a Catholic school near Fontainebleau. One of my classmates, who had arrived at the beginning of the year, intrigued me a great deal. He was different, secretive. I was getting to know him, learning to love him when, one morning, our little world fell apart. I have tried to rediscover that first, and most powerfull, friendship that was so abruptly destroyed; and my introduction to the absurdities of the adult world with its violence and prejudices.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louis Malle and Nouvelles Éditions de Films

results.title: Attack Force Z
results.brief_description: Hidden on a small Pacific Island is a man with a secret that could end the Second World War and the killer elite Attack Force Z is sent in to get him out… or die in the attempt.
results.description: Hidden on a small Pacific Island is a man with a secret that could end the Second World War and the killer elite Attack Force Z is sent in to get him out… or die in the attempt.

results.title: Asterix in Britain
results.creator_credit: Yannik Piel, Gaumont-British Instructional, Dargaud Films and Pino Van Lamsweerde
results.brief_description: The world-famous comic-strip character, that madcap Gaul, Asterix is brought to life in this animated feature. The battle skills of the Britons are undeniably the equal of Caesar’s Roman troops. However, they are handicapped by their habit of refusing to fight on weekends and leaving the battlefield promptly at five every afternoon in time for tea. Whilst the Britons are caught napping after dinner, the Romans win the war and overrun Britain. A plea from the English leader, Zebigboss, goes out to the mighty Asterix and his Roman-hating friend Obelix. Join all the familiar friends in this great adventure including Druid Getafix, Dogmatix, Chief Vitalstatistix, Cacofonix and many more. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: As good as it gets
results.creator_credit: James L. Brooks, Kristi Zea, Bridget Johnson and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Melvin (Jack Nicholson) has established a regimented lifestyle which enables him to cope with his obsessive-compulsive disorder. His routine existence is interrupted by changes in the lives of his neighbour Simon (Greg Kinnear), and his waitress Carol (Helen Hunt). Caring for Simon’s dog, and his involvement in Carol’s personal life puts him back in touch with a humanity which has been lacking in his structured life. Powerful performances from Jack Nicholson and Helen Hunt, who both won Best Actor Oscars for their efforts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James L. Brooks, Kristi Zea, Bridget Johnson and Tri-Star Pictures

results.title: Arlington Road
results.creator_credit: Mark Pellington, Peter Samuelson, Marc Samuelson, Tom Gorai and Lakeshore Entertainment
results.brief_description: After his FBI agent wife is killed by an extremist group, college professor Michael Faraday moves his son and himself to a new neighborhood, to make a fresh start. Driving home from work one day he saves the life of a boy, the son of his neighbours Oliver and Cheryl Lang. Becoming friends with the Langs’, Michael’s life begins to improve, he has a new girlfriend, his son is happy, and he has a job teaching American History at the local college - specialising in terrorism and extremist activities. Soon he begins to notice details of Oliver’s stories don’t add up. Are his neighbours as normal as they seem? Cast includes Jeff Bridges, Tim Robbins and Joan Cusack.
